result.execSummary:
The defendant Raymond D Bankhead was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: No violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause.
Pay costs, assessments and surcharges or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant.

Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Court grants expungement upon successful completion of the sentence and request submitted to the Court before 8-1-15.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Raymond D Bankhead in court with attorney Glenn E Gaskill.  William Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Sentencing proceeds.  Statements by counsel and defendant.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve  4 months at the House of Correction - straight time - with 1 day credit.  COURT STAYS the sentence and places the defendant on probation for a period of  1 year.

CONDITIONS:  1) no violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) pay costs, assessments and surcharges or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant; 3) perform 80 hours of community service; 4) SERVE 14 DAYS at the House of Correction - no good time. 

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.  Copy given to the defendant.  

Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Court grants expungement upon successful completion of the sentence and request submitted to the Court before 8-1-15.

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY to the amended charge and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Amended  Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, victim, a friend or relative of the defendant and defendant.  Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 72 hours in advance of sentencing.

Defendant Raymond D Bankhead in court with attorney Glenn E Gaskill.  William Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Amended Information received and filed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of a copy of the Amended Information and waives reading.  Court AMENDS the charge to Possession of Cocaine 961.41(3g)(c) an unclassified misdemeanor.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Raymond D Bankhead in court with attorney Glenn E Gaskill.  Nathaniel E Adamson for William Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Case may be resolved with a possible deferred prosecution agreement.  Defendant needs a TAD assessment.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Raymond D Bankhead in court with attorney Glenn E. Gaskill.  William Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Information received and filed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of a copy of the Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty.  Defense has received discovery.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Raymond D Bankhead in court with attorney Glenn E. Gaskill.   Chris Liegel for Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  
NO DA OR DA FILE IN COURT.
Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44.  Arraignment scheduled for March 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Court ordered no possession or use of NO ILLEGAL DRUGS.

Defendant Raymond D Bankhead in court with attorney Glenn E. Gaskill.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.     Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 11, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 3-3-14 @ 1:30 P.M.
